content: the gorge pumpkin crochet pattern by stacey of fitfoodart shop pattern/photographs of this design are the property of fitfoodart shop you may not sell/distribute this pattern items created using this pattern may be sold but must credit fitfoodart shop please tag @fitfoodartshop #fitfoodartshop in any product photos if you d like to be featured 7 7 7 fitfoodartshop com facebook instagram stacey@fitfoodart com 1 materials & pattern notes skill level beginner @equestriann style materials super bulky 6 weight yarn i used malabrigo rasta but lby wool -ease thick & quick would work too m/n 9/10mm crochet hook i used 10mm scissors measuring tape yarn needle fiber fill / stuffing sticks terms & abbreviations chain chain st s stitch es ch2 chain 2 turning chain doesn t count as a stitch yarn malabrigo rasta in carrot double_crochet double_crochet hook knitter s pride ginger hook 10mm note i recommend malabrigo rasta check out fitfoodart shop on w/ a 10mm hook or lby wool-ease youtube for lots of great video thick & quick w/ a 9mm hook you tutorials click here could also follow the recommended hook size on your yarn label and this pattern will still work pattern/photographs of this design are the property of fitfoodart shop you may not sell/distribute this pattern items created using this pattern may be sold but must credit fitfoodart shop please tag @fitfoodartshop #fitfoodartshop in any product photos if you d like to be featured 7 7 7 fitfoodartshop com facebook instagram stacey@fitfoodart com 2 gorge pumpkin pattern row 1 chain 14 1dc in the third chain from the hook double_crochet in each st to end then ch2 & turn your work 12 sts *note the ch2 is just your turning chain it does not count as a stitch row 2 double_crochet in each st to the end of the row ch2 & turn 12 sts repeat row 2 until you have a long rectangle that measures approx 14 inches long cut your yarn leaving a generous tail for sewing and pull it through the last loop on your hook click here for the full video tutorial *gauge is not important for this pattern to work you could certainly make different sized pumpkins by starting with a smaller/larger number of chains or working less/more row the finished size of the pumpkin is approx 5 5 inches wide by 3 5 inches tall see sewing stuffing & finishing steps on page 4-5 > pattern/photographs of this design are the property of fitfoodart shop you may not sell/distribute this pattern items created using this pattern may be sold but must credit fitfoodart shop please tag @fitfoodartshop #fitfoodartshop in any product photos if you d like to be featured 7 7 7 fitfoodartshop com facebook instagram stacey@fitfoodart com 3 seam it up line up the edges of your long rectangle using one of your yarn tails and a darning needle run the tail through each stitch on both edges now you should have a cylinder tube shape click here
